body:
@ku21fan Why I changed backends/cudnn/init.py was  failure.
  File "E:/Joy-corps/bi-rnn-torch.py", line 119, in <module>
    rnn.cuda()
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 147, in cuda
    return self._apply(lambda t: t.cuda(device_id))
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 118, in _apply
    module._apply(fn)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\rnn.py", line 116, in _apply
    self.flatten_parameters()
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\rnn.py", line 68, in flatten_parameters
    if not any_param.is_cuda or not torch.backends.cudnn.is_acceptable(any_param):
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 50, in is_acceptable
    if _libcudnn() is None:
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 17, in _libcudnn
    lib = ctypes.cdll.LoadLibrary(None)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\ctypes\__init__.py", line 426, in LoadLibrary
    return self._dlltype(name)
  File "C:\ProgramData\Anaconda3\lib\ctypes\__init__.py", line 348, in __init__
    self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode)
TypeError: bad argument type for built-in operation
